entry.title: Revert "ðŸ§ª Refactor Make*AccountAvailable* identity test utils methods"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 909072ee0272f930334ac593496fe21f9d1d8ce5.



Reason for revert: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1458240



Original change's description:

> ðŸ§ª Refactor Make*AccountAvailable* identity test utils methods

>

> Refactors and dedupes the `MakeAccountAvailable` methods to control

> their behavior based on the passed arguments. Currently the variants

> of these methods have each their own separate implementation, making

> it hard to switch between them and to know how to compose them with

> other utility methods.

>

> This unlocks some new combinations, for example setting the primary

> account and its Gaia cookie at the same time.

entry.title: [Extensions c2s] Display confirmation message on request access button
entry.content:
Reland of crrev.com/c/4582732. Original CL was reverted because

`mac13-arm64-rel-tests` had consistent failures. However, CQ run was

successful for `mac13-arm64-rel` (which includes `mac13-arm64-rel

tests`) when test was run 100 times on crrev.com/c/4637343. Therefore,

disabling the test on Mac since it seems to be flaky vs consistent.



----------------------------------------------------------------------



Display a confirmation message for kConfirmationDisplayDuration on the

request access button after it has been clicked.



This CL doesn't fix the animation issues with the extension toolbar

button (puzzle piece)

entry.title: Android: Never cache BuildInfo in tests
entry.content:
Knowing when to call (and then subsequently reset)

BuildInfo.resetForTesting() after mocking out the underlying system

is complicated. Skirt this issue by not caching the instance in tests.



Also deletes change-detector tests from BuildInfoTest.

entry.title: [fix-swo-violations] Fix sort comparison function
entry.content:
Make sure CompareDisplays comparison function is a strict weak ordering

by fixing compare(a, a) to return false.

Using a comparator which is not a strict weak ordering is undefined

behavior and crashes with _LIBCPP_DEBUG_STRICT_WEAK_ORDERING_CHECK

enabled.

entry.title: multipaste: Notify controller observers on clipboard history cleared
entry.content:
This CL propagates notifications that clipboard history was cleared to

clipboard history controller observers. Currently, controller observers

are only told when an item is added or removed individually, meaning

they will not know to update if all items are removed at once.

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: Fill in V4L2StatefulVideoDecoder::Initialize()
entry.content:
This CL fills in said method (for both the first and subsequent

Initialize() calls). In particular it adds the OUTPUT queue and

configures it as per spec.



FTR this is tested on hana using video_decode_accelerator_tests,

e.g.:



/usr/local/libexec/chrome-binary-tests/video_decode_accelerator_tests

/usr/local/share/tast/data_pushed/go.chromium.org/tast-tests/cros/local/bundles/cros/video/data/test-25fps.h264 '

--vmodule=*/media/gpu/*=2,*/media/gpu/v4l2/*=3'

entry.title: multipaste: Clear clipboard when clipboard history is cleared
entry.content:
Currently, the system clipboard is kept in sync with the first item in

clipboard history at all times. However, this invariant would not hold

if there were a code path that allowed clipboard history to be cleared

without the clipboard being cleared first.



This CL ensures that when clipboard history is cleared, the clipboard is

always cleared as well.

entry.title: Add metrics to confirm traffic difference between CSBRR and hit report
entry.content:
The metrics added last week (https://crrev.com/c/4611266) show some

evidence on the traffic difference between ClientSafeBrowsingReport

and hit report:

* For mainframe warnings, around 20% of reports are not sent because

there is already a report being collected.

* For subresource warnings, 90% of reports are not sent because

there is already a report being collected.

Now we have a good explanation for subresource warnings, but there is

still a gap for mainframe warnings. Add more metrics to investigate

further.



Histograms added:

1 interstitial.CloseReason

This is helpful to understand the proportion of reports skipped because

users close the entire tab.



2 SafeBrowsing.ClientSafeBrowsingReport.HasThreatDetailsForTab.SecurityInterstitial

This is a breakdown of the original histogram because I realize the

result is diluted by other types of reports (mainly ads sample).



3 SafeBrowsing.ClientSafeBrowsingReport.HasThreatDetailsInContainer.SecurityInterstitial

This is to double check that as long as the collector is found, the

threat detail job is not null. In theory, it should always be not null.



4 SafeBrowsing.HitReport.IsSubresource

This is to track the total volume of hit reports from the client-side

and the break down between mainframe and subresource reports.

entry.title: [omnibox][post-ac][ml] Don't ML score sync autocomplete passes.
entry.content:
The 1st autocomplete pass needs to remain sync. Otherwise, weird bugs

can come up when callers who only run the sync pass expect the results

to be ready immediately after running synchronous autocompletion.



This is also why we don't debounce the sync pass.



ML scoring is currently restricted to the last autocomplete pass

(`done_`). The last pass is usually async, since the typical

autocomplete flow is a sync pass followed by multiple async passes. So

the last pass is usually is async, and `done_` is usually a sufficient

condition.



However, when the classifier is ran (e.g. when copying text, navigating,

using search companion, and probably other uses as well), autocompletion

consists of only a single sync pass. The last, and only, pass is sync,

not async, and `done_` becomes insufficient.



This CL modifies the ML condition from `done_` to `done_ &&

sync_pass_done_`.



This fixes a bug where companion search was running the sync

autocomplete pass, ML scoring ran preventing the results from being

updated syncly, then companion search would read the old results before

ML scoring completed.

That bug only occurred when both ML scoring and debouncing were enabled.

Each feature alone would not cause an issue.

- Debouncing alone was ok, since it does not debounce the sync passes.

- ML scoring alone was ok, since even though it would apply to the sync

pass, the search companion would not wait for ML scoring and look at

the pre-ML-scored results.

- When both are enabled, the intermediate results, like the

pre-ML-scored results, are hidden and search companion is forced to

use the last finalized result.



We plan to merge this into m116.



Bug: 1340291, 1405555, b/288280002

Change-Id: I19a3581cfde87f7019c138d739d6a6dbd20f0ffb

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4641280

entry.title: [omnibox][cr23] Update layout with hover fill enabled.
entry.content:
crrev.com/c/4611098 implemented hover fill. This CL updates the layout.



https://screenshot.googleplex.com/64fGjkafz9dy8Dw



This required redoing the view hierarchy, otherwise, 1 of the following

requirements would break:



- The remove suggestion 'x' should be vertically centered and 16px from

the right edge of the hover fill.

- The buttons should be clipped and not painted outside the hover fill

when the browser window is too narrow to show the buttons completely.

Out-of-bounds buttons are still keyboard focusable.

- The button focus ring should not be clipped by the suggestion view

above them.

- The selection indicator should remain 40px high and top-aligned with

the hover fill.

- The 4px wide selection indicator should not indent suggestions.

- The remove suggestion 'x' mouse target should remain equal to its

hover circle (24x24px), rather than stretched to its parent view.



Also increases the left margin of the omnibox and dropdown texts by 1px,

from 55px to 56px.



Low-Coverage-Reason: a) existing code, b) need to merge this to m116

entry.title: Test that SIGSYS fails the mac sandbox tests
entry.content:
Previously, Mac sandbox tests that unexpectedly generated

a SIGSYS (e.g. tests that enable a syscall filter but

then use denied syscalls) did not fail the tests because

our signal handler did not correctly reraise the signal.



Now our signal handler functions correctly

(https://crrev.com/c/4602549), so we can add another Mac

sandbox tests that ensures a denied syscall fails the

test.

entry.title: Stop re-absolutization of out of flow insets for getComputedStyle()
entry.content:
When we `getComputedStyle()` of an inset property of an out-of-flow

element, if the value is 'auto', percent or calc, we currently redo

the absolutization from the ComputedStyle. This is error-prone, has

known failures in WPT, and makes it impossible to work with anchor

positioning (and especially position fallback).



As we have already absolutized these values during layout, this patch

simply caches them on LayoutResult to be passed to getComputedStyle().

To minimize memory overhead, this patch makes NGLayoutResult to

unconditionally store the resolved insets (+8 bytes per box), plus

creating RareData if the box's offset in container doesn't match the

resolved insets.



Fixed: 867616

Fixed: 1423493

Fixed: 1451020

entry.title: Adjust CrOS touch selection menu spacing.
entry.content:
Adjust padding, corner radius and button size according to Figma mocks

at go/next-e14s-touchtext. Some details are still not quite right (e.g.

separators between buttons are slightly offset), can fix these later.



Note that TouchSelectionMenuViews is used from both

TouchSelectionControllerImpl and TouchSelectionControllerClientAura, so

we remove some padding added in TouchSelectionControllerImpl and instead

apply it from TouchSelectionMenuViews so that it is consistent between

views and web content.



We also slightly adjust one of the TouchSelectionControllerClientAura

browser tests since the padding change means the menu gets in the way of

one of the taps. Might be good to rewrite this test more cleanly at some

point, but for now just adjust the tap position so it doesn't overlap

with the menu.



These changes are just planned for CrOS at the moment (maybe Desktop

Chrome later), keep it all behind a flag for now.

entry.title: Do not generate can_use_on_swarming_builders field.
entry.content:
With https://crrev.com/c/4637531, the presence of a swarming dict in the

test spec is signal enough to swarm the test and the test spec's

can_use_on_swarming_builders value is not used at all. This change stops

generating the field into the json files. The field is still valid to

include in the the input to the generator script as it provides a means

of being able to disable swarming for an individual test and also

provides the signal that a test is actually intended to be swarmed

rather than just getting a swarming field from a mixin.



Bug: 1268499

entry.title: Allow network service to not wait for FPS initialization
entry.content:
Rollout metrics are indicating a heavy latency cost associated

with First-Party Sets at startup, and it's suspected that this is

because the network service waits until the feature is initialized

before sending requests. This waiting is unnecessary in the vast

majority of cases. We'd like to be able to configure this behavior

to validate that this is the cause of the metrics regression.



Bug: 1458054

entry.title: [execCommand] Use `send_keys` in `EditorTestUtils.sendKeys`
entry.content:
As `keyDown`/`keyUp` aren't fully supported ,

this patch changes `EditorTestUtils.sendKeys` to use

`send_keys` instead of `KeyDown`/`keyUp` when there are no

modifier keys.



In addition, this patch supports `0xE017` as `Delete` in

`test_driver_internal.send_keys`, as defined by "Keyboard

actions"[1] because the change above started to hit "Error:

No support for this code: U+e017".



This patch changes existing two errors in editing tests:

* "Error: We do not support keydown and keyup actions, please

use test_driver.send_keys. See crbug.com/893480"

* "Error: can only send actions in top-level window"



to one of these:

* Pass.

* Failed to match expectations, probably actual failures.

* "Error: element send_keys intercepted error"



[1] https://w3c.github.io/webdriver/#keyboard-actions



Bug: 893480, 1420675

Change-Id: Ic5ecf8b2f11657f5714357e633705fc4d5c9ebd0

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4639443

Auto-Submit: Koji Ishii

Commit-Queue: Kent Tamura

Reviewed-by: Kent Tamura

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1162610}

entry.title: [User Education] More versatile string substitution in IPH title, body
entry.content:
Changes the parameters for MaybeShow[Feature]Promo across BrowserWindow

and FeaturePromoController to take a variant "format parameters"

argument for body and title, with the default for both being "none".



Supported formats are:

- No substitution

- Single string (for convenience)

- 1 or more strings

- Cardinal number with singular/plural



Note: GetSingleOrMultipleStringUTF16() is not supported as it is not actually used anywhere in the code.



Bug: 1457739

Change-Id: Id52aacb89407ef3d4765f52f986cbdf8aece4f79

Reviewed-by: Emilia Paz

entry.title: Simplify First-Party Sets enterprise policy tests
entry.content:
This makes a few refactoring changes aimed at making the tests'

behavior more obvious and less subtle. This includes:

* Removing mutable state (`pref_enabled_`) from the test fixture

* Corollary: `SetEnabledPolicyState` explicitly accepts the state

that the test wants to set the policy to, instead of implicitly

computing it.

* Inlining single-use helpers

* Making as much state completely private as possible

(`https_server_`)

* Reducing the responsibilities of subclass test fixtures

(`GetOverridesPolicy` just returns the json string, it isn't

responsible for manipulating the PolicyMap directly)



Change-Id: I0e928b5e316b55b9a20d166396f12653d9dd238b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4642350

Commit-Queue: Chris Fredrickson

entry.title: Revert "Renew Storage Access permission grants from user interactions"
entry.content:
This reverts commit e69bb704722489870fea7d16febdc88b2932c51b.



Reason for revert:

Breaks ChromeOS build.

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/chromeos-arm-generic-rel/105996/overview



```

[18630/36215] CXX obj/chrome/browser/storage_access_api/storage_access_api/storage_access_api_service_impl.o

FAILED: obj/chrome/browser/storage_access_api/storage_access_api/storage_access_api_service_impl.o

../../build/cros_cache/chrome-sdk/symlinks/arm-generic+15516.0.0+target_toolchain/bin/armv7a-cros-li...(too long)

../../chrome/browser/storage_access_api/storage_access_api_service_impl.cc:78:39: error: no viable conversion from 'ContentSettingsForOneType *' (aka 'vector *') to 'absl::optional'

&grants);

^~~~~~~

```



Original change's description:

> Renew Storage Access permission grants from user interactions

>

> This gives ContentSettings the ability to be refreshed, if they were

> initially set with a lifetime & expiration. The Storage Access API

> tab helper uses this ability to refresh a Storage Access API grant

> after user interaction in an embedded context, at most once per day

> per grant.

>

entry.title: [ios] Do not start DiscoverFeedService on ACR if not already started
entry.content:
App Close Refresh experiment showed huge increase in CUI#1 AppFlows,

specifically launch start events. The reason for this is that

the DiscoverFeedService is often not started (e.g., when the current

tab on a cold start is non-NTP). If the service was not previously

started, ACR causes it to be instantiated, thereby triggering a

Discover launch event when the app is backgrounding. Future work will

need to change the triggering of launch events. But this CL is enough

to stop the ACR LE from artificially causing AppFlow count increases.



Change-Id: I699989c5b682fe95040d7933b3c7525c646354fe

entry.title: Multiplanar: WritePixelsYUV autogen and RasterImplementation support
entry.content:
This change adds a new WritePixelsYUV api on RasterInterface that will

be used for YUV texture uploads directly to a multiplanar shared image

as part of multiplanar project. This is needed as earlier, the pixels

were written per plane per mailbox and each shared image was cleared

after writing. With multiplanar shared image, we need to upload and

write pixels for all planes together as we cannot clear shared image

after a plane and cannot know when it is called for the last plane as

clients may call them out of order. Instead we add a new WritePixelsYUV

api which will be called from VideoFrameYUVMailboxesHolder and

VideoResourceUpdater callsites to upload for multiplanar textures

directly for software upload paths.



Here, we add autogenerated code for raster decoder and implement the

necessary support within RasterImplementation. A follow-up change

will implement support within the RasterDecoder.



Bug: 1414564

entry.title: Adding `OnPointerHoverWithMotionEstimator` experimental predictions to UMA.
entry.content:
The output of `OnPointerHoverWithMotionEstimator` predictors is a logit

score that is based on mouse motion estimates. To use this score for

pre* heurstics, we should compare it to a threshold.

Threshold choice affects classifier precision and recall. There is a

trade-off between precision and recall.

To choose the best threshold, we can use ROC curves, precision-recall

curves, or logit-precision and logit-recall curves.

In this CL we collect the UMA data required to achieve this.



Bug: 1446707

entry.title: Update tab selected and hover colors for GM3.
entry.content:
In GM3, selected and hovered tabs have their own colors, instead of merely being interpolations of the active and inactive tabs colors like in GM2. This is reflected by overriding GetTabBackgroundColor in TabStyle and GetTargetTabBackgroundColor in TabStyleViews, which were doing those interpolations for GM2.



There are two fallback modes for themes:

1) for a color-based theme, e.g. one from customize chrome, we approximately emulate the blending done in GM2, but at the color mixer level. See the comment added in tab_strip_color_mixer.cc for details.

2) for an image-based theme, we directly use the blending behavior of GM2. There are a lot of rough edges here right now - this will need another pass.



Known issues:

- Colors for some combinations of tab selection states and frame activeness states will need adjustment / iteration with designers.

- Image themes look ~atrocious~ in GM3. Will need a separate CL to address.

entry.title: Disable |blackhole_detector| while waiting for new network for connection migration
entry.content:
* Once a network has been disconnected. |OnNetworkDisconnectedV2| is executed which will try to find an alternative network to migrate to(connection_migration flag is on). However, If no

new network shows up then a flag will be set that a search is going on and keep the socket alive until |kWaitTimeForNewNetworkSecs| has passed.

* The problem lies is that the blackhole detector is still running and if the deadline of the blackhole detector comes before |kWaitTimeForNewNetworkSecs| then the connection

will be closed with QUIC_CONNECTION_TOO_MANY_RTOS. This leads to early tearing of sockets which might be incorrect in-case of new network showing up after the blackhole deadline.

* This change disables the blackhole detector deadlines since the writer is blocked on network level so no new packets should be written. Once a new network has been found then

the writer will be unblocked which will re-send packets and re-activate the blackhole detector again.

* Implemented a unit-test which disconnects the network and make sure that the blackhole detector has been stopped.

* Implemented a unit-test that disconnects the network and make sure that the blackhole detector is stopped then

connects to a new network and verify that the blackhole detector is resumed.

entry.title: iwa: Save in-memory ControlledFrame partitions in WebAppRegistrar
entry.content:
We want to keep track of in-memory ControlledFrame partitions for data

clearing. In-memory Storage Partitions will delete themselves at browser

shutdown. However, to clear data in the middle of browser life-cycle, we

must track of all the in-memory partitions. This map

(isolated_web_app_in_memory_controlled_frame_partitions_) does not have

to accurately track in-memory Storage Partitions because eventual

consistency is guarateed in the next browser life-cycle (i.e. in-memory

Storage Partitions will begone and map will be reset).

We derive the DOM `key` field of `keydown` and `keyup` events from

the whole Unicode code-point of the input character, rather than

from the first UTF16 code-unit.



This does not impact generation of keypress events which are

generated directly from the NSEvent by RenderWidgetHostViewCocoa which are restricted to single UTF-16 code unit character events.

entry.title: [omnibox] Avoids redundant call to MessageLite::ByteSizeLong()
entry.content:
MessageLite::SerializeToString() calls MessageLite::ByteSizeLong() to

find out the array size to allocate for serializing the proto. This

step is redundant as MessageLite::ByteSizeLong() is called just prior

to that. According to the protobuf documentation[1], ByteSizeLong()

recursively calls ByteSizeLong() on all embedded messages.

ByteSizeLong() is generally linear in the number of fields defined for

the proto.



Using MessageLite::SerializeWithCachedSizesToArray()

avoids that extra step and should help minimize the potential cost of

repeated calls to TemplateURLRef::HandleReplacement().



To support this, this CL also adds a base::Base64UrlEncode() interface

that directly accepts binary data. the existing base::Base64UrlEncode()

that accepts a StringPiece calls the binary variant with very trivial

code changes. This is similar to the variants for base::Base64Encode().



[1] https://protobuf.dev/reference/cpp/api-docs/google.protobuf.message_lite/#MessageLite.ByteSizeLong.details

entry.title: [AXMode] Add policy for AccessibilityPerformanceFiltering
entry.content:
This CL adds the necessary infrastructure for an enterprise policy for

the AccessibilityPerformanceFiltering feature, currently only used on

Android. This infrastructure includes elements for both the policy and

corresponding pref:



* Policy yaml file and updated policies.yaml

* Corresponding pref mapped to policy with pref name defined in ui/

* AccessibilityPrefsController for registering 1) pref and 2) event

handler for communicating pref change to BrowserAccessibilityState

* New API in content/public/BrowserAccessibilityState for setting

accessibility pref state

* Implementation in BrowserAccessibilityStateImpl for setting and

getting accessibility pref state

* Conditional logic in WebContentsAccessibilityAndroid for pref to

enable AccessibilityPerformanceFiltering feature



Associated launch here: launch/4240411



AX-Relnotes: N/A

entry.title: [Omnibox] Reset cached dimens on Autocomplete startup
entry.content:
We restart the activity if density changes, so this is a suitable proxy

and won't waste computation in the common case. This prevents a bug

where we cache pixel offsets calculated using a stale dpToPX multiplier,

causing us to use incorrect margins.

entry.title: Replacing CHECK with if() statement in StoragePartitionImpl.
entry.content:
This CL replaces a CHECK to see if NetworkContextFilePaths exist with

a conditional that only creates the paths if they do not exist. This is

because ChromeContentBrowserClient::ConfigureNetworkContextParams()

initialize NetworkContextFilePaths so the CHECK will hit and crash, but

StorageParitionImpl::InitNetworkContext doesn't want to override

existing filepaths so they only need to be created if a caller does

not initialize them itself.

entry.title: [scheduler] Introduce TaskQueue::Handle which owns TaskQueue
entry.content:
(5/8) of TaskQueue lifetime refactor, which will make sequence manager

TaskQueue uniquely owned and a pure virtual interface implemented by

TaskQueueImpl.



This CL makes TaskQueue uniquely owned (no longer ref-counted), owned by

a new Handle class which is exposed via SeqMgr::CreateTaskQueue().

TaskQueue::Handle is a unique_ptr-like class which owners can use to

access the queue. This indirection is used to ensure task queues are

shut down properly, i.e. handed to SequenceManager to be destroyed at

the end of the task, which the handle will do once TaskQueue is an

interface implemented by TaskQueueImpl.



Previous CLs made it so task queues have a unique scoped_refptr

"owner", so this CL is mostly mechanical % the Handle logic:

- CreateTaskQueue() returns a Handle and callsites are updated

- TestTaskQueue (SequenceManager unittests) is stored as a

unique_ptr instead of scoped_refptr. TestTaskQueue will be

removed in a follow-up so that handles are used in tests, but

this is not done here to keep the change as mechanical as

possible.

entry.title: [Chrome Refresh] Unify bookmarks folder icon used across platforms.
entry.content:
For refresh, the folder icons should be the same for all platforms. Previously png resources were present for windows/mac. This CL refactors

the logic to use the vector icon to a separate function and uses it irrespective of the OS.



Future CLs will update the icon color and the size.
